result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick J Melsheimer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).
  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Bond amount posted shall be applied.  If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment.  Defendant allowed to drive from Milwaukee to Indianapolis and back for purposes of employment with UPS.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall have no contact with any one under the age of 18 without agent approval.

Defendant shall not possess or use pornography and/or sexually explicit materials.

Defendant shall not possess or use a computer or any technological device including a cell phone with internet capabilities without prior written permission from the agent.  

Defendant shall have no contact with Debra M.

Defendant shall not enter any establishment where the primary purpose is sale or service of alcohol.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with recommendations.

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

Defendant shall comply with sex offender registration.

Defendant shall complete sex offender treatment, assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall submit to random drug screens.

timeConds.notes: To be served at the agents discretion.  With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Bond amount posted shall be applied.
All conditions of Count 1 are inclusive of Count 2.

Def in person & by Atty William Andrew Mayer.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  State moves to amend Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 to Third Degree Sexual Assault a Class G Felony-940.225(3); Court grants amendment.  State agrees to recommend probation and condition time with defense free to argue.  Court request State file an Amended Information.   No contest plea entered to Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 as amended.  Court dismissed Ct. 3 for read-in.  Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 as amended and enters judgment.   Presentence Investigation Report ordered.
